amendment.description: To protect the United States against efforts of China and other foreign entities to engage in economic espionage and to misappropriate United States intellectual property, research and development, and innovation efforts.

action.text: Motion to table amendment SA 1802 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 55 - 40. Record Vote Number: 215.

Amendment SA 1802 proposed by Senator Rubio to Amendment SA 1527. (consideration: CR S3551, S3838-3839; text: CR S3551-3552) To protect the United States against efforts of China and other foreign entities to engage in economic espionage and to misappropriate United States intellectual property, research and development, and innovation efforts.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to table amendment SA 1802 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 55 - 40. Record Vote Number: 215.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1802 proposed by Senator Rubio to Amendment SA 1527.
